content: It works like a regular Visa Credit Card, but taps into your home equity to get you really, really low rates. Aven is a credit card that lets you use your home equity to get really low rates. Aven combines the convenience of a credit card with the savings of a home equity line of credit (HELOC). It works like any other credit card where you can make everyday purchases and earn unlimited 2% cash back. For Cash Outs and Balance Transfers, you have the option of fixed monthly payments (Aven Simple Loan). Lock in your payments for 5 or 10 years. A 2.5% fee per cash out applies. Monthly payments work like a standard credit card, calculated as 1% of the principal balance, plus monthly interest, plus any fees. You can directly deposit cash from your Aven card to your bank account at the same low rate, with a 2.5% transfer fee. Checking your offer does not affect your credit score; a hard credit check is performed only when you finalize with a notary. There are no annual, sign-up, or pre-payment fees, but there is a 2.5% fee on Cash Outs and Balance Transfers and a $29 late fee for missed minimum payments. The page also features educational articles on various financial topics.
SUPPORT How can we help? Search question, keywords, or topics Message Us Schedule A Callback Cant find what you need? Search question, keywords, or topics Message Us Schedule A Callback

metadata.title: Aven | Building the machine for consumer finance | Aven Card

content: How It Works It works like a regular Visa Credit Card, but taps into your home equity to get you really, really low rates. What is the Aven Home Card? Aven is a credit card that lets you use your home equity to get really low rates. How does it work? Aven combines the convenience of a credit card with the savings of a home equity line of credit (HELOC). It works like any other credit card where you can make everyday purchases and earn unlimited 2% cash back. Do you offer a fixed rate? For Cash Outs and Balance Transfers, you have the option of fixed monthly payments (Aven Simple Loan). Lock in your payments for 5 or 10 years. 2.5% fee per cash out applies. Available right in the app. What is my monthly payment? Monthly payments work like a standard credit card. It is calculated as 1% of the principal balance, plus monthly interest, plus any fees. Can I get cash too? Yes! You can directly deposit cash from your Aven card to your bank account at the same low rate. A 2.5% transfer fee applies. Does this affect my credit score? Checking your offer does not affect your credit score. Only once you schedule with our notary to finalize will we do a hard credit check. Are there any fees? We try to reduce as many of the fees as possible. No annual, sign-up, or pre-payment fees. There is a 2.5% fee on Cash Outs and Balance Transfers and a $29 late fee if you dont make the minimum payment. Become an Expert Grow your knowledge with our educational articles written by our team of experts.

Important: This AutoPay Agreement (Agreement) sets out the terms and conditions authorizing Aven Financial, Inc. (Aven), to debit your Designated Account (defined below). Please save or print this Agreement for your records. This Agreement will also be available in your Aven mobile app and on the aven.com website (or any successor sites or apps). Payments for amounts owing on your Aven Card account (Account) can be made from a checking or deposit ( Designated Account) through the Aven mobile app. When you select the Designated Account, you represent to Aven that you own the Designated Account and are authorized to initiate debits from the Designated Account and to direct Aven, Coastal Community Bank, any respective successor or assign of either party (collectively, Servicer), to withdraw funds from the account to pay balances due under your Account. If there are insufficient funds (NSF) in your Designated Account on the specified withdrawal date, Servicer reserves the right to take payment in whole or in part when funds become available. In that case, fees may apply, such as NSF and late payment fees, and interest may be assessed on certain balances according to the terms of your Account agreement. By enrolling in AutoPay, Servicer will debit your Designated Account each billing period on the date(s) (AutoPay Date) under the applicable options below and in your selected amount(s) (Amount). To receive confirmation of the Amount transfer taking place (Payment), you can view your account using the Aven mobile app or online at my.aven.com (or any successor sites or apps), call your bank, or call Aven Customer Service at the number on the back of your Aven card.  AutoPay Options When you enroll in AutoPay, you may be given some or all of the following options (AutoPay Options): 1. Statement Balance  Once Per Month: The Payment is the full balance shown on your monthly statement, less any credits or payments posted to your Aven account up to 1 business day prior to the due date shown on your monthly statement (the Statement Due Date). The AutoPay Date will be the Statement Due Date. 2. Current Balance  Once Per Month: The Payment will be the current amount outstanding on your Account as of the AutoPay Date. The AutoPay Date will be the Statement Due Date. 3. Current Balance  Twice Per Month: Each of the Payments for the month will be the current amount outstanding on your Aven account as of the AutoPay Dates. The AutoPay Dates will be (a) the Statement Due Date and (b), if the Statement Due Date is on or before the 14th of the month,14 days after the Statement Due Date or, if the Statement Due Date is on or after the 15th of the month, the date 14 days before the Statement Due Date. 4. Minimum Amount Due: The Payment will be the Minimum Amount Due shown on your monthly statement, less any payments posted to your Aven account up to 1 business day prior to the AutoPay Date. The AutoPay Date will be the Statement Due Date. 5. Fixed Custom Amount: The Payment will be the fixed custom amount you select (Fixed Custom Amount), except as follows: (a) if the Minimum Amount Due shown on the monthly statement is greater than the Fixed Custom Amount, we will debit the Minimum Amount Due, and (b) if the current amount outstanding on your Aven account is less than the Fixed Custom Amount, we will deduct the current amount outstanding. The AutoPay Date will be the Statement Due Date.  Additional Terms A. No Payment will be taken if, as of the AutoPay Date, your Aven account has no amounts owing. B. A Payment should not cause you to have a credit balance on your Aven account. But, if you manually make a payment within 1 business day of your AutoPay Date, you could cause a credit balance. We will not debit any AutoPay Amount that is greater than the current amounts owing on your Aven account on the AutoPay Date. C. Returned payments may not be reflected at the time your monthly statement is produced. D. If your AutoPay Date falls on a weekend or federal holiday, your Payment will be debited from your Designated Account on the following business day. However, your Aven Account records will reflect that the payment was credited to your Aven Account on the AutoPay Date. For purposes of AutoPay, business days are Monday through Friday, except that federal holidays falling on Monday through Friday are not business days. E. Servicer is authorized to debit Payments from your Designated Account consistent with your chosen AutoPay Option until you adjust or cancel AutoPay as described below. F. You must have sufficient funds in the Designated Account on the AutoPay Date to cover the Payment. G. If your Aven Account is canceled and there is an outstanding balance, Servicer may continue to debit Payments from your Designated Account unless you have canceled AutoPay as described below. H. By enrolling in AutoPay as described herein, you may be eligible for cash back rewards in accordance with Avens Rewards Terms and Conditions and a discount on certain applicable percentage rates.  Adjusting or Canceling AutoPay You may adjust or cancel AutoPay through the Aven mobile app or by logging into your Aven Account at my.aven.com. Your adjustment or cancellation must be done at least 2 business days before your next scheduled AutoPay Date. Aven may cancel AutoPay for you at any time for any reason and will provide you notice of such cancellation. AutoPay cancellation may affect your cash back rewards earnings and the annual percentage rate for your Account.

This document, effective January 1, 2022, is an E-SIGN Consent from Aven Financial, Inc. and its affiliates. It requires user consent for the use of electronic signatures and the electronic delivery of communications, disclosures, and notices for services on Avens websites and mobile apps. By consenting, users agree that their electronic signatures are legally binding. The types of information provided electronically include credit account documents, privacy notices, and credit score disclosures. To access these, users need a valid email, phone number, internet connection, a current web browser, a PDF reader, and a compatible device. Users can request free paper copies by contacting infoaven.com. Consent can be withdrawn by exiting an application before completion or by emailing suppportaven.com after an account is opened, which may result in the loss of some services.

metadata.title: E-SIGN Consent to Electronic Signatures and Electronic Delivery of Disclosures and Notices

content: CONSUMERPRIVACYNOTICE Rev 0225 FACTS: WHATDOES AVENDO WITHYOURPERSONALINFORMATION? Why? Financial companies choose how they share your personal information. Federal law gives consumers the right to limit some but notall sharing. Federal law also requiresus to tellyou howwecolect,share,and protect your personal information. Please read this notice carefully to understand what we do. What? The types of information we colect and share depend on the product or service you have with us.This information can include: Social Security numberand income accounts balances and payment history credit history and credit scores. How? Al financial companies need to share customerspersonal information to run their everyday business. In the section below,we listthe reasons financial companies can share their customerspersonal information,the reasons Aven chooses to share,and whether you can limit the sharing. Reasons we can share your personal information: For our everyday business purposessuch as to process your transactions, maintain your account(s),respond to court orders and legal investigations,or report to credit bureaus (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? No). For our marketing purposes- to offer our products and services to you (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? No). For joint marketing with other financial companies (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? No). For our affiliateseveryday business purposes- Information about your transactions and experiences (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? No). For our affiliates everyday business purposes- Information about your creditworthiness (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? Yes). For our affiliates to market to you (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? Yes). For non-affiliates to market to you (Does Aven share? Yes, Can you limit this sharing? Yes). To limit our sharing: Email us at supportaven.com. Please include Limit Sharingin the subjectline of the email and include anyall of the following opt-out statements in the body of the email to indicate your choices: Do not share information about my creditworthiness with your afiliates for their everyday business purposes. Do not allow your afiliates or non-afliates to use my personal information to market to me. Please note: If you are a new customer, we can begin sharing your information 30 days from the date we provided this notice.When you are no longerour customer,we can continue to share your information as described in this notice. However, you can contact us at any time to limit our sharing. To limit direct marketing: Please note:We may contact ourexisting customers by mail,email,or telephone to offer additional financial products or services.You may direct us not to send you such offers. To limit our direct marketing to you by mail,email,or telephone,email us at privacyaven.com. Questions? Call 1.877.761.1080 or email us at supportaven.com. Who we are: This privacy notice is provided by Aven Holdings,Inc.,and its afiliates,including,but not limited to,Aven Financial, Inc.,Aven Financial Technologies, Inc., Aven Crypto,Inc.,Aven Auto,Inc.,and Credit Builder, Inc. (collectively, Aven). What we do: To protect your personal information from unauthorized access and use,we use security measures that comply with federal law. These measures include computer safeguards and secured files and buildings.We authorize our employees to obtain your information only when they need it to do their work and we require companies that work for us to protect your information. How does Aven collect my personal information? We collect your personal information,for example,when you: apply for a loan, give us your income information, open an account, use your credit card, pay your bills. We also collect your personal information from others, such as credit bureaus,afiliates,or other companies. Why cant I limit all sharing? Federal law gives you the right to limit only: sharing for afiliates everyday business purposesinformation about your creditworthiness, affiliates from using your information to market to you, sharing for non-afiliates to market to you. State law and individual companies may give you additional rights to limit sharing. What happens when Ilimit sharing for an account I hold jointly with someone else? Your choices will apply to everyone on your account unless you tellus otherwise. An account holder may express a privacy preference on behalf of the other joint account holders. Definitions: Affiliates are companies related by common ownership or control. They can be financial and nonfinancial companies. Ouraffiliates include companies referred to collectively above as Aven, including, butnot limited to,AvenFinancial, Inc.,AvenFinancial Technologies, Inc.,Aven Crypto, Inc., Aven Auto, Inc., and Credit Builder Inc. Non-affiliates are companies not related by common ownership or control. They can be financial and nonfinancial companies. Non-affiliates we share with can include financial services companies, such as mortgage lenders;nonfinancial companies such as retailers;and other companies such as nonprofit groups. Joint marketing is a formal agreement between non-afliated financial companies that together market financial products or services to you. Our jointmarketing partnersmay include other financial services companies. Other important information: We may contact our existing customers by mail, email, or telephone to offer additional financial products or services. You may direct us not to send you such offers. To limit our direct marketing to you by mail, email, or telephone, email us at supportaven.com. For California residents: In accordance with California law, we will not share information we collect about you with companies outside our corporate family, except as permitted by law. For example, with your consent, to service your account, or provide you with rewards you are entitled to. We will limit sharing among our companies to the extent required by California law. For Vermont residents: If you live in Vermont, we will share information only as permitted by law. We will not share your personal information with non-affiliates for their marketing purposes, unless you authorize us to do so. We will not share consumer report information about you with joint marketing partners or with affiliates, except with your consent or to the extent otherwise permitted by law. ForNorthDakotaresidents:Inaccordance withNorthDakota law,we willnotshare informationwecollectaboutyou with companiesoutsideofourcorporatefamilyexceptaspermitedbylaw,including,forexample,withyourconsentortoserviceyour account. We willimit sharing among our companies to the extent required by North Dakota law. Important Information about Credit Reporting: Wemayreportinformationaboutyourcreditaccounttocreditbureaus.Latepayments,missedpayments,orotherdefaultsonyour account may be reflected in your credit report.

Your Aven Card transaction is likely to be conducted in English. The information you receive and the official documents you will sign will likely be in English. We want you to understand the transaction. Translations may be available to complement the English language documents during the notary session. These documents are to help you understand the transaction. Aven may not be able to provide you with the translation services, or translated documents, or provide support in languages other than English. Actualmente, Aven no proporciona documentos en idiomas distintos al inglés durante el proceso de registro, servicio u otros aspectos de su proceso. Invitamos a los solicitantes a que incluyan su propio traductor (Por ejemplo un familiar con un fuerte dominio del idioma Inglés) para entender nuestros productos. Sin embargo solo se pueden utilizar traductores profesionales durante la notarización; Aven puede proveer dichos servicios después de solicitarlos. Para garantizar que el solicitante comprenda el proceso, los documentos, nuestros productos y sus obligaciones, Aven tomará registro de la inclusión de un traductor en el proceso del solicitante y requerirá una autorización firmada del solicitante para que el traductor pueda participar.

content: Welcome! Enter your mobile number. Mobile Number This field is required Continue Help By continuing, you agree to our Privacy Policy

This document is a consumer handbook on Adjustable-Rate Mortgages (ARMs) from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). It explains that an ARM is a mortgage with an interest rate that can change, potentially leading to higher monthly payments. The handbook advises consumers to consider an ARM only if they can afford the maximum possible payment. It compares ARMs with fixed-rate mortgages, detailing that an ARMs interest rate is composed of an index and a margin. The document guides readers on how to use their Loan Estimate to understand the terms, including the initial interest rate, how often it can change, and its maximum limit. It also explains the Adjustable Interest Rate (AIR) table, which details the calculation of interest rate changes. The booklet warns about potential risks such as teaser rates, paying points to temporarily reduce the rate, interest-only ARMs where the principal balance isnt paid down initially, and payment-option ARMs that can lead to negative amortization. It encourages consumers to shop around, ask lenders specific questions, and consider if an ARM fits their financial situation.

This document is a guide on Home Equity Lines of Credit (HELOCs), a loan that allows borrowing against the equity in your home. It explains how to use the booklet to understand your options. A HELOC is a line of credit where you can borrow, spend, and repay as you go, with your home as collateral. The booklet advises considering a HELOC only if you are confident in your ability to make payments, as failure to do so could result in losing your home. It compares HELOCs to other financial sources like second mortgages, cash-out refinances, personal lines of credit, retirement plan loans, and credit cards, detailing their pros and cons. The guide outlines the mechanics of a HELOC, including up-front costs, the draw period for borrowing, and the repayment period, which might conclude with a balloon payment. It also discusses how variable interest rates work, typically composed of an index and a margin. The document highlights consumer rights, such as required disclosures from lenders and the three-day right to cancel the credit line. It also notes that lenders can freeze or reduce the credit line if the homes value drops or the borrowers financial situation changes. The booklet encourages consumers to shop around and compare at least three HELOC offers.

metadata.title: WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW ABOUT Home Equity Lines of Credit (HELOC)

content: This privacy policy, last revised in December 2024, outlines how Aven Holdings, Inc. and its subsidiaries collect, use, and share personal information. The policy applies to services including aven.com and its subdomains but excludes nonpublic personal information related to financial products, which is covered by a separate Consumer Privacy Notice. Aven collects various types of personal information such as identity, contact, property, and location data, both directly from users and automatically through technologies like cookies. This information is used for service provision, marketing, security, and personalization. Personal data may be disclosed to banking partners, service providers, data aggregators, affiliates, and for legal reasons. Users have choices regarding their data, including opting out of direct marketing and managing cookies. The policy also details specific rights for California residents under the CCPA, such as the right to access, delete, and correct their information, and to opt-out of the sale or sharing of their data. Contact information for inquiries and data rights requests is provided.
